metadata.synopsis: Things go from bad to worse for singing cowboy Roy Rogers (Roy Rogers) and his trusty companion, Teddy Bear (Guinn "Big Boy" Williams), when, after losing their jobs at a local café, the pair are accused of having kidnapped young Chip Williams (Mary Lee) who, in reality, is merely a runaway who's been tagging along with the cowpokes. But amidst these problems, Roy and his partner decide to team up with the girl and her half-sister, Ysobel (Dale Evans), and search for some long-buried treasure.

reviews: Noted only because it was the first of 27 films Dale Evans made with Rogers.
Charming, old-fashioned B-Western that first paired Roy Rogers and Dale Evans.
